commit.message: Release 2.11.0

Merge pull request #210 from guhehehe/master

Support dfs.client.use.datanode.hostname config property

Support dfs.client.use.datanode.hostname config property

When reading blocks, client talks to datanode by default using the datanode's
IP address returned by the name node. The problem with this approach is that
the IP address is a private IP within the cluster, so the client won't works if
it is in a different network. This commit updates the config module to support
dfs.client.use.datanode.hostname config property, and have the clients to use
this property to determine weather to use the IP address or the hostname to
talk to datanodes.
Release 2.10.1

Merge pull request #209 from spotify/revert-206-retry_block_read_failures

Revert "Add client retry for block read failures"
Revert "Add client retry for block read failures"
Release 2.10.10

Merge pull request #206 from steffengr/retry_block_read_failures

Add client retry for block read failures

Add client retry for block read failures

Currently the client will fail on any block read errors even
though these might be transient failures. This patch enables
the client to retry block read failures to make it more
failure tolerant.

Merge pull request #204 from adamchainz/readthedocs.io

Convert readthedocs links for their .org -> .io migration for hosted projects

Convert readthedocs links for their .org -> .io migration for hosted projects

As per [their blog post of the 27th April](https://blog.readthedocs.com/securing-subdomains/) ‘Securing subdomains’:

> Starting today, Read the Docs will start hosting projects from subdomains on the domain readthedocs.io, instead of on readthedocs.org. This change addresses some security concerns around site cookies while hosting user generated data on the same domain as our dashboard.

Test Plan: Manually visited all the links I’ve modified.
Update Readme
Release version 2.9.0

Merge pull request #194 from steffengr/client_retry

Increase client robusteness by adding retry and request timeout

Increase client robusteness by adding retry and request timeout

Add a request retry logic for connection and request failures. Mimics
the behavior of the Java Hadoop client's FailoverOnNetworkExceptionRetry
strategy. Uses the retry and failover values from the Hadoop
configuration if set. This enables the client to not fail in case the
NameNode RPC queues are full or other transient failures happened that
cannot be solved by one failover.

Configure the channel socket to use the socket timeout as configured
for Hadoop after establishing the connection. This helps to not
time out when running slow operations on the NameNode, such as
large listings, or when having large and filled up RPC queues.
Version 2.8.2

Merge pull request #201 from pragmattica/write_as_binary

Changing the 'open' command to open a temporary file as binary.

Changing the 'open' command to open a temporary file as binary. The lack of this parameter causes a bug when using copyToLocal to copy a file from a Linux HDFS cluster to a Windows client box. The file that ends up on Windows isn't byte-identical to the starting file on Linux, due to some end-of-line conversion issue.
